intro: Ctenium concissum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ctenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Ctenium concissum is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
